meanings.definition: The order in which things follow each other.
meanings.sent1: The sequency of the numbers in the math problem was easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: She organized the files in sequency from oldest to newest.
meanings.sent3: The sequency of events at the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sequency of colors in the rainbow is always beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a fun song to teach the sequency of the alphabet.

meanings.definition: The quality of being sequential or in a sequence.
meanings.sent1: His work displayed a high level of sequency and organization.
meanings.sent2: The sequency of steps in the recipe made it easy to follow.
meanings.sent3: The sequency of her dance moves impressed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The sequency of notes in the music created a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent5: The sequency of colors in the painting added depth and dimension.
